channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Fly tipping in Pittville park, 2nd February
item.description:
Fly tipping in Pittville park nr gates to St Pauls

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 81 Marle Hill Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous parking too close to hump-back bridge, 1st February
item.description:
A trade van persistently parks (mostly after working hours) too close to the hump-back railway bridge to be easily seen by cars approaching from the west. I friend (who lives in a nearby location described it as "an accident waiting to happen" (a term I had also used) There has now been such an accident (overturned car) but the parking persists. Often the van is parked facing the wrong way and obscuring the red reflectors - which worsens the problem. The close proximity of a school adds to the danger. The problem has persisted for a while (6 months plus?) despite there being an obvious threat of serious injury and even death.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Two Hedges Road, Woodmancote
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Queens Road / Christ Church Road junction, 1st February
item.description:
4-way temporary lights installed, for cable works. What a GENIUS piece of planning, to install 4-way lights at this location now, considering the additional traffic currently using Queen's Road / Church Church Road to access the A40 due to the long-term closure of the Gloucester Road / A40 junction. Chaos at 8.10am this morning - traffic trying to turn into Christ Church Road from the A40 unable to, due to queuing traffic in Christ Church Road, not helped by the queue coming the opposite way, blocking access through the temporary lights at the Queens Road junction. Further not helped by the very short green light period on the permanent lights at the Christ Church Road / A40 junction - as previously reported a few days ago (Enquiry 11351610).
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 26 Queen's Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car abandoned on junction for 24hours, 31st January
item.description:
Car left on junction of St Pauls north and Swindon Road- no attempt to push off road to safety -many near misses tonight of cars not seeing vehicle - now insitu for 24 hours
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 53 Swindon Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trees require replacing, 31st January
item.description:
Over the years two trees have been removed due to storm damage and age. There is a gap on either side of the Avenue where the trees need to be replaced can this be organised please.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 11 Jersey Avenue, Cheltenham

item.title: Quantity of road signs, 31st January
item.description:
These have been abandoned for at least 2 years. Easy collection by the crew as dual lanes by the traffic lights at the junction of Hucclecote RoadG/Gloucester Business Park.

item.title: Grass area dug up by utility company, 31st January
item.description:
Recently a utility company dug up part of Newcourt Green and the adjacent footpath grass verge. Whilst the areas have been refilled with earth it is not clear that there are any plans to re-seed the area.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 7 Newcourt Road, Charlton Kings

item.title: Slippy, 30th January
item.description:
Inside of roundabout (Turning Right from David Lloyd), can be extremely slippy (in all weathers) Several time have lost grip or back end. Multiple people also experienced the same. Sometimes difficult to maintain control, even at slow speeds. Concerned for the danger that this patch of road can create for those who are not used to the area. Problem has been present for a number of years now
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 11 Golf Club Lane, Brockworth
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose / moving manhole cover & frame, 30th January
item.description:
A40 Lansdown Road - between junction with Shelburne Road and pedestrian crossing. Chamber cover has been loose / clanking for months. Cover & frame now moving (bouncing) every time a vehicles hits it, and multiple bad patches around frame breaking out. Needs to be repaired / replaced URGENTLY.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 88 Lansdown Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Waitrose trolley and Iceland trolley full of rubbish Abingdon Road car Park, 29th January
item.description:
The Iceland trolley has been around for weeks because it is from the Iceland superstore on Tewkesbury Road and not from the local Iceland it is getting progressively worse. Please ask the borough council to come and pick them both up. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 62-66 Edinburgh Place, Cheltenham
